courses.title: Essentials of Engineering Economy
courses.description: Introduction to engineering economic decision making, economic decision criteria, discounted cash flow, replacement and timing decisions, risk, depreciation, and income tax.

courses.title: Basic Statistical Methods
courses.description: Point and interval estimation of systems parameters, statistical decision making about differences in system parameters, analysis and modeling of relationships between variables.

courses.title: Methods of Quality Improvement
courses.description: Topics include quality system requirements, designed experiments, process capability analysis, measurement capability, statistical process control, and acceptance sampling plans. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE 3039 and ISYE 6382.

courses.title: Simulation Analysis and Design
courses.description: Discrete event simulation methodology emphasizing the statistical basis for simulation modeling and analysis. Overview of computer languages and simulation design applied to various industrial situations.

courses.title: Introduction to Supply Chain Modeling: Logistics
courses.description: Course focuses on engineering design concepts and optimization models for logistics decision making in three modules: supply chain design, planning and execution, and transportation.

courses.title: Introduction to Supply Chain Modeling: Manufacturing and Warehousing
courses.description: Design and operation of manufacturing and warehousing facilities.

courses.title: Cornerstone Design for Industrial Engineers
courses.description: Structure a complex problem through information gathering, data analysis, industrial engineering and design principles application, project management, while working in and leading diverse teams.

courses.title: Engineering Optimization
courses.description: Topics include modeling with networks and graphs; linear, nonlinear, and integer programming, construction of models employing modern modeling languages; and general solution strategies.

courses.title: Stochastic Manufacturing and Service Systems
courses.description: Methods for describing stochastic movements of material in manufacturing facilities, supply chain, and equipment maintenance networks. Includes analysis of congestion, delays, and inventory ordering policies.

courses.title: Statistics and Applications
courses.description: Introduction to probability, probability distributions, point estimation, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, linear regression, and analysis of variance. Crosslisted with MATH 3770 and CEE 3770. Also, credit not awarded for both ISYE 3770 and MATH 3670.

courses.title: Introduction to Cognitive Science
courses.description: Multidisciplinary perspectives on cognitive science. Interdisciplinary approaches to issues in cognition, including memory, language, problem solving, learning, perception, and action. Crosslisted with CS, PST, and PSYC 3790.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession, conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

courses.title: Design of Human-Integrated Systems
courses.description: Topics include general cognitive systems engineering concepts and principles, and specific concepts and principles of interface design, task analysis, prototyping, and empirical usability of evaluation methods.

courses.title: Regression and Forecasting
courses.description: Regression analysis: multiple linear regression, diagnostics, and variable selection.  Forecasting: exponential smoothing techniques and autoregressive moving average models.

courses.title: Decision and Data Analytics
courses.description: This course integrates decision and data analytics to solve real-world business problems.  It includes hands-on system modeling, data collection and analysis, and reporting writing projects.

courses.title: Advanced Simulation
courses.description: Advanced modeling and statistical concepts in discrete-event simulations; Monte Carlo simulation; estimation of error and risk; advanced input modeling techniques; comparison and optimization of systems.

courses.title: Senior Design
courses.description: Senior design project requiring student to formulate a project plan with an off-campus enterprise. Includes specific milestones, targets, and evaluation criteria.

courses.title: Advanced Supply Chain Logistics
courses.description: This course is a follow-up to ISyE 3103 that covers optimization models and case studies for logistics network design and logistics operations.

courses.title: Workflow Modeling, Analysis & Design in Manufacturing & Service
courses.description: Introduction to the modeling, analysis and design of workflow systems in manufacturing systems and service systems such as healthcare systems, banks, service centers and warehouses.

courses.title: Advanced Modeling and Analysis of Workflow Systems
courses.description: In-depth modeling and analysis of the workflow dynamics shaping the operation and performance of production and service systems. Application of stochastic modeling in practical problems.

courses.title: Advanced Optimization
courses.description: Theory and implementation of practical methods to find good or optimal solutions to optimization problems too large or complex to solve in a straightforward way.

courses.title: Constraint Programming
courses.description: This course is an introduction to constraint programming, from its modeling language to its computational methodology and its applications to scheduling, routing, and resource allocation.

courses.title: Advanced Stochastic Systems
courses.description: The course will cover Jackson Networks and Markov Decision Processes with applications to production/inventory systems, customer contact centers, revenue management, and health care.

courses.title: Supply Chain Economics
courses.description: The course studies techniques for coordination and collaboration in supply chains.  Applications include pricing strategies, revenue management, gaming, and incentives.

courses.title: Capital Investment Analysis
courses.description: Students learn core concepts and techniques for economic decision and analysis of complex capital investment problems that involve dimensions of time, uncertainty and strategy.

courses.title: Honors Optimization
courses.description: Topics parallel those in ISYE 4231 with an intended treatment that is more innovative and challenging. Credit not given for both ISYE 4331 and 4231.

courses.title: Energy, Efficiency, and Sustainability
courses.description: Analysis and modeling of energy production and use, material and energy efficiency, sustainability, and cost for systems, products, and services.

courses.title: Public Health Systems
courses.description: This course provides an overview of health systems and public health to explore their positive impact on well-being of individuals and effectiveness of health systems.

courses.title: Methods and Applications of Machine Learning
courses.description: This course introduces the available methods in machine learning, which methods are better in what situations, objective functions and errors, and how to tune parameters.

courses.title: Online Learning & Decision Making
courses.description: Fundamental theoretical tools for analyzing online methods, algorithmic techniques for developing computationally efficient methods, applications to real-world problems, and discussion around ethical and legal issues.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Bio-Inspired Design
courses.description: We examine evolutionary adaptation as a course for engineering design inspiration, utilizing principles of scaling, adaptability, and robust multifunctionality that characterize biological systems.  Credit not allowed for both ISYE 4740 and (BIOL 4740, or PTFE 4740 or MSE 4740 or ME 4740).

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: ISYE Senior Design Preparation.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession, conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession, conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession, conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Special Topics.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession, conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

courses.title: Honors Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in the field of ISYE that are covered with an appropriately high level of innovation and rigor.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in the field of ISYE.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Courses in special topics of timely interest to the profession, conducted by resident or visiting faculty.

courses.title: Special Problems
courses.description: A variable hour credit opportunity to develop initiative and apply fundamental principles by performing semioriginal laboratory or research work in ISYE.

courses.title: Special Problems
courses.description: A variable credit hour opportunity to develop initiative and apply fundamental principles by performing semioriginal laboratory or research work in ISYE.

courses.title: Special Problems
courses.description: A variable credit hour opportunity to develop initiative and apply fundamental principles by performing semioriginal laboratory or research work in ISYE.

courses.title: Organizational Behavior for Engineers
courses.description: Studies the scientific generation, formalization, and application of the knowledge of individual and group behaviors that engineers need to function effectively within contexts.

courses.title: Constraint Programming
courses.description: This course is an introduction to constraint programming, from its modeling language to its computational methodology and its applications to scheduling, routing, and resource allocation.

courses.title: Manufacturing Systems
courses.description: Topics include analysis of flows, bottlenecks and queuing, types of operations, manufacturing inventories, aggregreate production planning, lot sizes and lead times, and pull production systems.

courses.title: Warehousing Systems
courses.description: Topics include design and analysis of materials handling systems, warehouse layout, order picking strategies, warehousing inventories, warehouse management systems, integration of production and distribution systems. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE 6202 and ISYE 6383.

courses.title: Transportation and Supply Chain Systems
courses.description: Topics include supply chain characterization, site location, mode selection, distribution planning, vehicle routing, demand management, replenishment management, geographic information systems, and real-time control issues. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE 6203 and ISYE 6383.

courses.title: Cognitive Engineering
courses.description: Application of cognitive science concepts to system design, and the development of concepts appropriate for understanding and aiding cognition in naturally or technologically complex environments.

courses.title: Models in Human-Machine Systems
courses.description: The development and use of mathematical models of human behavior are considered.  Approaches from estimation theory, control theory, queuing theory, and fuzzy set theory are considered.

courses.title: Understanding and Supporting Human Decision Making
courses.description: Prescriptive and descriptive theories of human decision making are discussed/contrasted.  Approaches to aiding human decision making are considered in context of these theoretical frameworks.

courses.title: Topics in Human-Integrated Systems
courses.description: State-of-the-art research directions including supervisory control models of human command control tasks; human-computer interface in scheduling and supervision of flexible manufacturing systems.

courses.title: Advanced Engineering Economy
courses.description: Advanced engineering economy topics, including economic worth, economic optimization under constraints, risk and uncertainty, foundations of utility theory.

courses.title: Introduction to Financial Engineering
courses.description: Advanced techniques for economic analysis of capital investment. Basic terminology and financial engineering concepts for managing and valuing project risk. Real options applications in systems engineering.

courses.title: Productivity Measurement and Analysis
courses.description: Modern measurement of productivity measurement and analysis including principles, issues, and latest techniques associated with benchmarking, efficiency measurement, and productivity tracking.  Empirical studies and group projects.

courses.title: Economic Decision Analysis
courses.description: Topics include preferences and utilities, social choice, equilibrium concepts, noncooperative and cooperative game theory, price mechanisms, auction mechanisms, voting theory, and incentive compatibility.

courses.title: Design of Human-integrated Systems
courses.description: Analysis and design of complex work domains in technological environments.  Credit not allowed for both ISYE 6231 and AE 6721.

courses.title: Safety-critical Real-time Systems
courses.description: Study of system safety, human error, and software reliability.

courses.title: Measurement and Evaluation of Human-integrated Systems
courses.description: Measurements of complex systems including workload, operator strategy, and performance.

courses.title: Scheduling Theory
courses.description: Includes topics in sequencing and scheduling with emphasis on deterministic machine scheduling problems with some stochastic results examined.  Complexity of various problems will be analyzed.

courses.title: Public Impact Applications of Operations Research and Management Science
courses.description: The focus is on the health and public applications of Operations Research.  Students will complete a group project with a non-profit organization and discuss papers.

courses.title: Statistics for Supply Chain Engineering
courses.description: Collection, management, and analysis of supply chain data.

courses.title: Finance for Supply Chain Engineering
courses.description: Investment and analysis of operating capital.

courses.title: Operations Research for Supply Chain Engineering I
courses.description: Deterministic models of supply chains including location and material flow.  Optimization techniques including linear programming, network flows, integer programming, and heuristics.

courses.title: Operations Research fo Supply Chain Engineering II
courses.description: Probabilistic models of supply chains, including the effects of variability; models of wholesale and retail demand; forecasting and simulation.

courses.title: Supply Chain Engineering I
courses.description: Production scheduling; inventory systems; warehousing, including stocking strategies, order-picking, sortation, automation; distribution.

courses.title: Supply Chain Engineering II
courses.description: Transportation: truck-load and less-than-truckload, and package-courier systems; container shipping, including port operations, steamship scheduling; railroad operations, including intermodal; air cargo.  The international freight network and patterns of freight flow.  Management and recirculation of trailers/containers.  Labor issues.

courses.title: Supply Chain Engineering III
courses.description: Problems of coordination and collaboration along the supply chain; make-or-buy decisions; pricing and auctions; wholesale and retail channels; supply chain dynamics, including the bullwhip effect.  Distinctive supply chain issues in key economies.

courses.title: Suppply Chain Strategy
courses.description: Case studies of notable supply chains successes and failures.

courses.title: Supply Chain Information Systems
courses.description: Planning and executing systems for inventory, warehousing, transportation, import/export, etc.  Services-oriented architecture, cloud computing; systems integration; RFID and other technologies for scanning and monitoring.

courses.title: Supply Chain Engineering Seminar
courses.description: Through a program of industry speakers and facility tours, student will learn to assess and critique supply chain practice.

courses.title: Capstone Project for Supply Chain Engineering I
courses.description: Small groups of students undertake an industry-sponsored project under faculty guidance.

courses.title: Capstone Project for Supply Chain Engineering II
courses.description: Small groups of students undertake an industry-sponsored project under faculty guidance.

courses.title: Production Planning and Control
courses.description: Fundamentals of Production Planning and Lean Manufacturing.

courses.title: Manufacturing Reliability
courses.description: Fundamentals of Reliability and Maintainability Engineering.

courses.title: Quality Control and Six Sigma
courses.description: Fundamentals of Quality Control and Six Sigma Methods. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE 6382 and ISYE 3039.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Manufacturing Supply Chain Operations
courses.description: Fundamentals of Manufacturing Supply Chain Operations. Credit will not be awarded for both ISYE 6383 and ISYE 6202 or ISYE 6383 and ISYE 6203.

courses.title: Advanced Manufacturing
courses.description: Introduction to advanced manufacturing and applications of process modeling methods for understanding and improving processes and systems for advanced composites, nanomaterials/nanomanufacturing, and additive manufacturing.

courses.title: Statistical Modeling and Design of Experiments
courses.description: Fundamental coverage of topics in multiple regression and factorial experiments.

courses.title: Time Series Analysis
courses.description: Basic forecasting methods, ARIMA models, transfer functions.

courses.title: Nonparametric Data Analysis
courses.description: Nonparametric statistics and basic categorical data analysis.

courses.title: Statistical Methods for Manufacturing Design and Improvement
courses.description: Fractional factorial designs, response surface methods.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Statistics with Applications
courses.description: Relationships of statistical estimation and linear models with regression, planning and analysis of experiments, and the analysis of correlated data.  More mathematical than ISYE 6401.

courses.title: Theoretical Statistics
courses.description: Rigorous introduction to theory of statistical inference. Estimation and testing. Construction and assessment of estimators and tests. Fundamentals of decision theory, minimax, and Bayes Paradigms.

courses.title: Design and Analysis of Experiments
courses.description: Analysis of variance, full and fractional factoral designs at two and three levels, orthogonal arrays, response surface methodology, robust parameter design for production/process improvement.

courses.title: Statistical Modeling and Regression Analysis
courses.description: Simple and multiple linear regression, inferences and diagnostics, stepwise regression and model selection, advanced regression methods, basic design and analysis of experiments, factorial analysis.

courses.title: Computational Statistics
courses.description: This class describes the available knowledge regarding statistical computing. Topics include random deviates generation, importance sampling, Monte Carlo Markov chain (MCMC), EM algorithms, bootstrapping, model selection criteria, (e.g. C-p, AIC, etc.) splines, wavelets, and Fourier transform.

courses.title: Introduction to Theory and Practice of Bayesian Statistics
courses.description: Rigorous introduction to the theory of Beysian Statistical Inference. Bayesian estimation and testing. Conjugate priors. Noninformative priors. Bayesian computation. Bayesian networks and Bayesian signal processing. Various engineering applications.

courses.title: Biostatistics
courses.description: An introduction to fundamental ideas and techniques in Biostatistics, with an emphasis on conceptual understanding and on the analysis of real data sets.

courses.title: Introduction to Analytics Modeling
courses.description: An introduction to important and commonly-used models in analytics, as well as aspects of the modeling process.

courses.title: High Dimensional Data Analytics
courses.description: A variety of topics such as functional data analysis, image processing, multilinear algebra and tensor analysis, and regularization in high-dimensional regression.

courses.title: Simulation
courses.description: Covers modeling of discrete-event dynamic systems and introduces methods for using these models to solve engineering design and analysis problems.

courses.title: Monte Carlo Methods
courses.description: Covers state-of-the-art Monte Carlo simulation techniques. These techniques will be used to model and solve a variety of real-world problems from several diverse areas in science and engineering, including supply chain analysis and design, pattern recognition, VLSI design, network reliability, financial engineering, and molecular biology.

courses.title: Probabilistic Models and Their Applications
courses.description: An introduction to basic stochastic processes such as Poisson and Markov processes and their applications in areas such as inventory, reliability, and queueing.

courses.title: Queuing Theory
courses.description: Processing networks with queuing.  Performance analysis using Markov process description of system behavior. Applications and numerical studies in manufacturing, system maintainability, computer systems, telecommunication networks.

courses.title: Linear Optimization
courses.description: Theory, algorithms, and applications of linear programming.  Topics include the simplex method and resolution of degeneracy, duality and sensitivity analysis, basis factorization, the dual and revised simplex methods, and geometry of polyhedra. Intended for Ph.D. students.

courses.title: Discrete Optimization
courses.description: Fundamentals of integer and combinatorial optimization. Topics include polyhedra, cuts, Lagrangean duality, complexity, and others.  This course is intended for Ph.D. students.

courses.title: Nonlinear Optimization
courses.description: Fundamentals of nonlinear optimization.  Topics include optimality conditions; convex programming and duality; unconstrained and constrained methods. Polynomial algorithms and interior point methods. Dual methods. This course is for students seriously considering a PhD.

courses.title: Stochastic Optimization
courses.description: An introduction to sequential decision making under uncertainty.  Much of the course is devoted to the theoretical, modeling, and computational aspects of Markov decision processes.

courses.title: Deterministic Optimization
courses.description: An introduction to deterministic optimization methodologies including approaches from linear, discrete, and nonlinear optimization including algorithms and computations. Applications will be introduced as appropriate.

courses.title: Financial Optimization Models
courses.description: An introduction to optimization techniques with special emphasis on applications to finance, including portfolio optimization, immunization, and risk management.

courses.title: Computational Methods in Optimization
courses.description: Strategies and techniques for converting optimization theory into effective computational procedures.  Emphasis is on applications in linear, integer, and nonlinear programming; networks and graphs.

courses.title: Energy Technology and Policy
courses.description: Examines energy production, use, and production, use, and policy using quantitative engineering and policy analysis. Addresses resource constraints, physical principles, and policy analysis methods.

courses.title: Basic Statistical Methods
courses.description: Overview of basic tools used in statistical analysis and modeling.  Credit not allowed to students seeking a degree in ISYE.

courses.title: Computational Data Analysis: Learning, Mining, and Computation
courses.description: Theoretical/computational foundations of analyzing large/complex modern datasets, including the fundamental concepts of machine learning and data mining needed for both resesarch and practice. Crosslisted with CSE 6740. Credit not awarded for both ISYE 6740 and CS 4641/7641/CSE 6740.

courses.title: Applied Analytics Practicum
courses.description: Practical analytics project experience applying ideas from the classroom to a significant project of interest to a business, government agency, or other organization.

courses.title: Stochastic Processes in Finance
courses.description: Mathematical modeling of financial markets, derivative securities pricing, and portfolio optimization.  Concepts from probability and mathematics are introduced as needed. Crosslisted with MATH 6759.

courses.title: Stochastic Processes I
courses.description: Discrete time Markov chains, Poisson and renewal processes; transient and limiting behavior; average cost and utility measures of systems. Intended for Ph.D students. Crosslisted with MATH 6761.

courses.title: Stochastic Processes II
courses.description: Continuous time Markov chains; uniformization, transient and limiting behavior; Brownian motion and martingales; optional sampling and convergence.  Intended for Ph.D. students. Crosslisted with MATH 6762.

courses.title: Design and Implementation of Systems to Support
courses.description: Introduction to large-scale system design to support computational finance for options, stocks, or other financial instruments. Some programming experience and previous exposure to stocks, bonds, and options required.  Crosslisted with MATH 6767.

courses.title: Fixed Income Securities
courses.description: Description, institutional features, and mathematical modeling of fixed income securities.  Use of both deterministic and stochastic models. Crosslisted with MATH 6769.

courses.title: Managing Resources of the Technological Firm
courses.description: This course explores the competitive advantage manufacturing and service firms derive from the effective management of their technology, workforce, materials, and information resources. Crosslisted with MGT 6772.

courses.title: Strategic Management of Technology-based Ventures
courses.description: This course provides a forum for the in-depth examination of issues involving the strategic management of high-tech corporate start-ups and small technology-based businesses. Crosslisted with MGT 6773.

courses.title: Management of Technology Project
courses.description: This course organizes students into multidisciplinary teams devoted to solving a real problem for a technology-based firm.  Crosslisted with MGT 6774.

courses.title: Management of Technology Seminar
courses.description: This course introduces the frontiers of key technologies, provides a forum for visiting speakers from the corporate world, and supplements topics from other MOT courses. Crosslisted with MGT 6775.

courses.title: Analysis of Emerging Technologies
courses.description: Methods for technology monitoring, forecasting, and assessment. Crosslisted with PUBP 6777.

courses.title: Dynamic System Simulation and Modeling
courses.description: Models of dynamic systems, such as aircraft,ground vehicles, and machinery, and manual control. Numerical simulation techniques and applications. Interactive simulators. Student programming project. Crosslisted with AE 6779.

courses.title: Reliability Theory
courses.description: Structural properties and reliability of coherent systems.

courses.title: Statistical Techniques of Financial Data Analysis
courses.description: Fundamentals of statistical inference for models used in the modern analysis of financial data. Crosslisted with MATH 6783.

courses.title: The Practice of Quantitative and Computational Finance
courses.description: Case studies, visiting lecturers from financial institutions, student group projects of an advanced nature, and student reports, all centered around quantitative and computational finance. Crosslisted with MATH and MGT 6785.

courses.title: Computer Integrated Manufacturing Systems Seminar
courses.description: Guest speakers on a broad range of manufacturing-related topics:  research, applications, and technology. Required for Certificate in Manufacturing.  Crosslisted with ECE and ME 6792.

courses.title: Advanced Topics in Quantitative and Computational Finance
courses.description: Advanced foundational material and analysis techniques in quantitative and computational finance. Crosslisted with MATH 6793.

courses.title: Introduction to Cognitive Science
courses.description: Multidisciplinary perspectives on cognitive science. Interdisciplinary approaches to issues in cognition, including memory, language, problem solving, learning, perception, and action.  Crosslisted with CS and PSYC 6795.

courses.title: Reliability Engineering
courses.description: Topics include hazard functions, life distributions, censoring, life tables, nonparametric and parametric estimation and inference, accelerated life testing, structure functions, reliability and maintenance systems, replacement theory.

courses.title: Systems Monitoring and Prognostics
courses.description: The course focuses on sensor-based condition monitoring techniques, modeling of degradation processes, fault diagnostics and prognostics of failures in engineering systems using stochastic and statistical methods.

courses.title: Industrial Predictive Analytics
courses.description: The course focuses on using Statistical and Machine Learning-based models for survival analysis, and predicting future trends and events.

courses.title: Advanced Simulation
courses.description: Topics include generalized semi-Markov processes; input and output analysis; random number, variate, and sample path generation, rare event simulation; and optimization via simulation.

courses.title: Simulation Theory and Methods
courses.description: Theory, algorithms, and applications of computer simulation. Topics include generalized semi-Markov processes; input-output analysis; random number, variate, and sample path generation; variance reduction techniques; and optimization via simulation.  This course is intended for Ph.D. students.

courses.title: Master's Thesis
courses.description: Required of degree candidates in the master's thesis option.

courses.title: Production and Service Systems Engineering
courses.description: Advanced models in operations planning, scheduling and control of supply chain, production and service systems. Intended for Ph.D. students.

courses.title: Logistics Systems Engineering
courses.description: Advanced modeling and analysis of freight transportation and logistics systems.  Intended for Ph.D. students.

courses.title: Informatics in Production & Service Systems
courses.description: A course covers integration of statistics, signal processing and control for variability reduction (modeling, analysis, diagnosis, control) for complex systems in a data rich environment.

courses.title: Inventory Theory
courses.description: Introduces students to the general quantitative models and fundamental theoretical tools underlying some of the novel inventory management strategies of cutting-edge companies.

courses.title: Real-time Interactive Simulation
courses.description: Principles and laboratory experience in design and implementation of interactive simulations of complex dynamic systems.

courses.title: Advanced Design of Experiments
courses.description: Random and mixed models, nested and blocked designs. Intended for Ph.D. students and those seeking the M.S. in Statistics.

courses.title: Advanced Statistical Modeling
courses.description: Nonlinear models, logistic regression, loglinear models. Intended for Ph.D. students and those seeking the M.S. in Statistics.

courses.title: Multivariate Data Analysis
courses.description: Multivariate ANOVA, principal components, factor analysis etc. Intended for Ph.D. students and those seeking the M.S. in Statistics.

courses.title: Data Mining and Statistical Learning
courses.description: Topics include neural networks, support vector machines, classification trees, boosting and discriminant analyses. Intended for Ph.D. students and those seeking the M.S. in Statistics.

courses.title: Linear Statistical Models I
courses.description: Intended for Ph.D. students and those seeking the M.S. in Statistics.

courses.title: Graph Algorithms
courses.description: Algorithms for graph problems such as maximum flow, covering, matching, coloring, planarity, minimum cuts, shortest paths, and connectivity. Crosslisted with MATH 7510 and CS 7510.

courses.title: Case Studies in Logistics/Manufacturing
courses.description: Advanced topics in logistics and manufacturing through the use of industrial case studies.  Difficult modeling issues such as data representation and consistency will be introduced.

courses.title: Theory of Linear Inequalities
courses.description: Theoretical foundations of linear and integer programming. Topics include representation of polyhedra, polarity, simplex and ellipsoid algorithms, diophantine equations, Hilbert bases, total dual integrality, and others.

courses.title: Convexity
courses.description: Convex sets, theory of finite systems of linear inequalities, convex functions, convex programming.

courses.title: Advanced Nonlinear Programming
courses.description: Convex programming; linear, conic quadratic and semidefinite programming; cheap optimization methods for extremely large-scale convex problems.

courses.title: Advanced Combinatorial Optimization
courses.description: Typical coverage includes: Matching theory, network optimization, traversals in graphs, integrality of polyhedra, matroids, covers, cliques, and stable sets.

courses.title: Advanced Integer Programming
courses.description: General integer modeling concepts; valid inequalities and facets; duality; general algorithms such as branch-and-bound and branch-and-cut; special purpose algorithms; applications.

courses.title: Computational Mathematical Programming
courses.description: Study of solution techniques in mathematical optimization, emphasizing computational aspects of both theory and algorithms.

courses.title: Mathematical Foundations of Machine Learning
courses.description: Provides the mathematical background for two of the pillars of modern data science: linear algebra and applied probability.

courses.title: Probabilistic Graphical Models in Machine Learning
courses.description: The course provides an introduction to theory and practice of graphical models in machine learning. It covers three main aspects; representation, probabilistic inference, and learning.

courses.title: Cognitive Modeling
courses.description: A hands-on course covering a range of cognitive methodologies. It explores the analysis, development, construction, and evaluation of models of cognitive processing.  Crosslisted with CS and PSYC 7790.

courses.title: Math of Operations Research
courses.description: Topics include Real Analysis (countable sets, basic topological notions, sequence, series, continuity), Basic Linear Algebra (linear transformations, vector spaces, singular value decomposition), and writing mathematical proofs.

courses.title: First Year PhD Seminar
courses.description: Introduce IE/OR/ACO PhD graduate students to faculty and research topics, discuss and demonstrate basic graduate student resources, and acclimatize students to graduate school.

courses.title: Seminar
courses.description: Audit basis only.

courses.title: Seminar
courses.description: Audit basis only.

courses.title: Seminar
courses.description: Audit basis only.

courses.title: Contemporary Topics in System Informatics and Control
courses.description: A seminar course to introduce important research problems and applications related to the system informatics and control in production and service systems.

courses.title: PhD Presentation Seminar
courses.description: Seminar for PhD students in IE/OR/ACO to improve and practice technical communication skills.

courses.title: Colloquium in Cognitive Sciences
courses.description: Reading of research papers by leading cognitive scientists, attendance at their colloquia, and meeting with them to discuss research. Crosslisted with CS and PSYC 8795.

courses.title: Special Topics in ISYE
courses.description: Special Topics in Industrial and Systems Engineering.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Special topics in Industrial and Systems Engineering.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Special topics in Industrial and Systems Engineering.

courses.title: Special Topics in Operations Research
courses.description: Special Topics in the field of Operations Research.

courses.title: Advanced Topics in Statistics
courses.description: For Ph.D. students.

courses.title: Topics in Manufacturing
courses.description: Current topics in manufacturing including: manufacturing automation and controls, advanced planning systems, heuristic scheduling techniques, stochastic models of manufacturing systems, advanced warehousing, and materials handling.

courses.title: Topics in Logistics
courses.description: Current topics in logistics including: inventory control in supply chain design, stochastic vehicle routing, computational methods in logistics systems, location theory, and geographic information systems.

courses.title: Advanced Topics in Stochastics
courses.description: Coverage of advanced topics of interest that support research interests of students in the field.

courses.title: Advanced Topics in Simulation
courses.description: Coverage of advanced topics of interest that support research interests of students in the field.

courses.title: Advanced Topics in Linear and Discrete Optimization
courses.description: Topics may vary with each offering and include subjects such as integer programming, combinatorics, graphs and networks, matching, matroids, polyhedral combinatroics, as well as others.

courses.title: Advanced Topics in Nonlinear Optimization
courses.description: Similar to ISYE 8871 but deals with subjects in nonlinear programming, interior-point methods, convexity, global optimization, etc. Topics may vary each term.

courses.title: Teaching Assistantship
courses.description: For graduate students holding graduate teaching assistantships.

courses.title: Research Assistantship
courses.description: For graduate students holding graduate research assistantships.

courses.title: Elementary Japanese I
courses.description: Introduction to listening, speaking, reading, and writing in Japanese and to the culture of Japanese-speaking regions.

courses.title: Elementary Japanese II
courses.description: Continued listening, speaking, reading, and writing in Japanese with further study of the culture of Japanese-speaking regions.
